ol.li: We can use sigma notation to denote a series.
It is possible to add infinitely many terms and arrive at a finite sum if the terms are small enough.

li.p: The sum of an infinite geometric series ~~\displaystyle{\sum_{k=0}^{\infty} ar^{k-1}}~~ is S_{\infty} = \dfrac{a}{1-r}~~~~~~\text{if}~~~~-1 \lt r \lt 1

ol.li: If \abs{r} \gt 1 in an infinite geometric series, the series does not have a sum.
